replies.msg:
Kerber entered Wimbledon as the No. 11 seed. She defeated 2010 finalist Vera Zvonareva, 2017 girls champion Claire Liu, no. 18 seed Naomi Osaka and Belinda Bencic en route to the quarterfinals, where she became the highest seed left in the draw. She beat Indian Wells finalist Daria Kasatkina and 2017 French Open champion Jelena Ostapenko to reach her second Wimbledon final, where she faced and defeated Serena Williams in 2 sets in a rematch of the 2016 final. With this victory, she returned to the top 5 at No. 4.
